{{book | title=Tolkien Calendar 2021 | image = Tolkien Calendar 2021.jpg | illustrator=[[John Howe]], [[Alan Lee]] and [[Ted Nasmith]] | publisher=[[HarperCollins]] | date=[[1 September]] [[2020]] | format=Calendar | pages=32 | isbn=978-0063022171 | precededby=[[Tolkien Calendar 2020]] | followedby=[[Tolkien Calendar 2022]] }} The '''''Tolkien Calendar 2021''''' was the official Tolkien calendar published by [[HarperCollins]] on [[1 September]] [[2020]]. It features art by [[John Howe]], [[Alan Lee]] and [[Ted Nasmith]] to tie in with the publication of the 40th anniversary illustrated edition of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s ''[[Unfinished Tales]]''. ==From the publisher== {{blockquote|The official Tolkien calendar, this year containing twelve stunning paintings inspired by the stories collected in ''Unfinished Tales'' by J.R.R. Tolkien. Three of the world’s finest Tolkien artists present the Three Ages of [[Middle-earth]] in breath-taking glory.

The official Tolkien calendar has become an established publishing event, eagerly anticipated by Tolkien fans the world over. Previous Tolkien calendars have become much sought after collector’s items, and this year’s will doubtless be an essential purchase for Middle-earth fans everywhere, as it celebrates the 40th anniversary of ''Unfinished Tales''.

To commemorate this special occasion, three of the world’s finest Tolkien artists – Ted Nasmith, John Howe, and Alan Lee – have each contributed four full-colour artworks to the Calendar. To accompany each painting, every month features complementary pencil drawings or sketches selected by the artists which are exclusive to this calendar.

In this unique artistic combination, Alan, John and Ted present scenes from the [[First Age]] of ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', the [[Second Age]] of [[Númenor]] and the fall of [[Sauron]], and the [[Third Age]] of ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', which will take the reader deeper into the world of Middle-earth than ever before.}} ==Illustrations== * January - "[[:File:Ted Nasmith - Taniquetil.jpg|Taniquetil]]" by Ted Nasmith * February - "[[:File:John Howe - Beleg Approaches Amon Rûdh.jpg|Beleg Approaches Amon Rûdh]]" by John Howe * March - "[[:File:Alan Lee - Eldalondë the Green.jpg|Eldalondë the Green]]" by Alan Lee * April - "[[:File:John Howe - Glaurung and Azaghal.jpg|Glaurung and Azaghâl]]" by John Howe * May - "[[:File:Ted_Nasmith_-_Aldarion_Returns_From_His_First_Voyage.jpg|Aldarion Returns From His First Voyage]]" by Ted Nasmith * June - "[[:File:Alan Lee - Amroth and Nimrodel.jpg|Amroth and Nimrodel]]" by Alan Lee * July - "[[:File:John Howe - The Battle of Dagorlad.jpg|The Battle of Dagorlad]]" by John Howe * August - "[[:File:Alan Lee - A Chance Meeting.jpg|A Chance Meeting]]" by Alan Lee * September - "[[:File:Ted Nasmith - The Oathtaking of Cirion and Eorl 2020.jpg|The Oathtaking of Cirion and Eorl]]" by Ted Nasmith * October - "The Hunt for the Ring" by John Howe * November - "[[:File:Alan Lee - Glaurung Departs Nargothrond.jpg|Glaurung Departs Nargothrond]]" by Alan Lee * December - "[[:File:Ted Nasmith - He Beheld a Vision of Gondolin Amid the Snow.jpg|He Beheld a Vision of Gondolin Amid the Snow]]" by Ted Nasmith ==See also== * ''[[The Tolkien Calendar 1987]]'' {{tolkiencalendars}} {{title|italics}} [[Category:Official calendars|2021]]
